## This room will be closed and archived.
** @/all Please move discussion of this topic to our forum, or to one of the official Free Code Camp chat rooms: http://forum.freecodecamp.com/t/free-code-camp-official-chat-rooms/19390**

-----

-----

-----

##Please note that we now recommend campers use their Campsite’s Facebook group for chatting instead of their campsite’s Gitter chatroom. 
We are doing this because few of our Campsite Gitter chatroooms have active synchronous discussions, and about 1/3rd of conversations consist of someone saying “hello” and not getting a response. Most of the discussions are asynchronous, which Facebook posts and group messages are better suited for.
We’ve removed this Gitter room from our Campsite directory. Still, we will keep it open for archival purposes, and you can keep using it if you’d like.
Here’s a short blog post about how our Campsites are evolving and growing: http://blog.freecodecamp.com/2015/09/jump-start-your-local-campsite-with-coffee-and-code.html

Hey guys and gals, looking for a little help for my High School FIRST FRC robotics team. I am a programming mentor and our new season is starting.  Last year we went to State Championships and to World Champs in St. Louis. This year we are in desperate need of CAD mentors and another programming mentor.  We have to limit the number of students we can take because we don't have enough mentors to help. I would hate to see any kid turned away. We meet in Battle Creek (Springfield) on Thursday nights. We dont need experts, just looking for someone committed to helping regularly and willing to learn.  We are a non-profit organization, so mileage and any donations are tax deductible. If you are interested, or know of anyone else that may be interested, give me a shout. Thanks!

@rxsangria oh, I'm not saying you should look at the zipline code - I only meant that if you come across a website doing something groovy you can look at their code. And sometimes if I've done something particularly dumb on one of my sites, I can open developers tools, make changes right there and see what happens. I've been building sites since the 90s.  I'm old enough to remember hamster dance and mouse trails. LOL
@LibertysYarn The zipline specifically says 'don't look at the original code'. I admit that I had to peek at it for a couple of elements! How long have you been developing?

Over the years I've learned to love 'view source' (ctrl-u) and (if you're in Chrome) the developers tools. I've learned to much just checking out how someone else did it. And Stack Overflow is a sanity saver. =D

@jhois went back to the portfolio zipline, there's a link in the instructions to fork a sample so you don't have to start from scratch. I didn't see that before (was it there?)  Anyways, it's a little easier modifying an already existing framework, although it still is a lot of work!  The Bootstrap link that @LibertysYarn posted helps too.

Also anyone interested in Chicago webvisions conference http://www.webvisionsevent.com/chicago/ later this week (Sept 24-5, Thurs &/or Fri)? On twitter I found a free admission code via a social entrepreneur firm helping nonprofits, PUBLICGOOD, and that's the code (PUBLICGOOD) you input when you register; about 12 hours ago, I got in for free, so may still be working

Hi everyone, I'm still where I was, got off-track cuz...(summer, vacay, visitors, other projects, health issues) whatever. Anyway, got off-track; so cool to see several of YOU making such quick progress! Inspirational. I find it difficult to not have much local in-person contact; anyone go to any local meet-ups?GR? A2/Detroit?
Oh hey great tip, thanks!
If you go to the [Bootstrap page](http://getbootstrap.com/getting-started/) - it gets much less scary. =D
Yeah I still haven't done that if you have any tips let me know.  I don't feel prepared to do it at all.
I started the portfolio zipline. Is it just me, or is it super complicated? It says 'don't look at the original code', but why?  Seems like they want us to re-invent the wheel!

On javascript,  it's also a codacademy review for me. I will let you know when I'm done reviewing and on to Bonfires.  Should be in the next couple of days. :smile:  :fire:
